page.title: 10Education in Whalley
page.content: Education was introduced to Whalley by monks in about the 14th century.The school moved to the{Old Grammar School (now an{Adult Centre)}in 1725.In 1844 the village school was erected and has remained on this site until today. A child living in Whalley might start his education at a{Playgroup} such as is organised at the{Old {Grammar School.}The child would be about the age of 3 years.Here he would play with toys and be told stories. At the age of 5 he would go to a {Primary School.}Whalley C.E.Primary caters for 5 to 11 yr. olds.Here they would learn to read,write and count. At 11 the child would then transfer to a{Secondary School.}There are 2 secondary schools in our area,Oak Hill a private school and St.Augustine's R.C. High.Many Whalley pupils transfer to{Clitheroe}secondary schools.
